intro: Epilobium andinum, commonly known as Andean willow or Andean pink, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in alpine environments, often at elevations above 3,000 meters. The plant features slender, woody stems covered with glandular hairs and produces showy, pink to purple flowers in clusters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinct, aromatic scent. Epilobium andinum is valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used in traditional medicine by indigenous communities.
